main event: On December 27, 1957, in Ballinger, Texas, a sighting of one object the size of a walnut, intense white in color, and making no sound was reported. The object appeared to gain altitude and then disappeared. The length of observation was 1 1/2 minutes, and the object's course was from northeast to north.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a walnut, with intense white color, and no sound, indicating unusual characteristics.
The conclusion suggests that it was probably a balloon or possibly an aircraft, but there was insufficient data for evaluation.
The report includes a civilian witness and indicates the duration and course of the sighting.
There were handwritten notes indicating rapid movement of an object typical of aircraft and multiple sightings of similar objects in the vicinity.

A radarman and an AFP officer observed five lights traveling together at high speed, with no blips on the radar, and a National Guard pilot reported similar lights at the same time period at different altitudes.
sighted object: one object size of walnut, intense white in color, no sound
witnesses: civilian, radarman, AFP officer, National Guard pilot
